description: The executive dashboard displays the users usage and operating systems count for hosts and vms.

panels.content: ###### The executive dashboard displays the users resource usage and operating systems count for hosts and virtual machines.

panels.description: This table details user Spice activity - time spent and resources used in the session in a selected data center and cluster within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR45 - This query returns for each VM in the specific data center , the
-- hourly or daily statistics: session time, CPU and memory usage statistics.

SELECT DISTINCT
    v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id,
    v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
    history_datetime,
    username AS user_name,
    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_name,
 -- hourly_daily.vm_id,
    session_time_in_minutes,
    cpu_usage_percent,
    max_cpu_usage,
    memory_usage_percent,
    max_memory_usage,
    user_cpu_usage_percent,
    max_user_cpu_usage_percent,
    system_cpu_usage_percent,
    max_system_cpu_usage_percent,
    v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date AS cluster_delete,
    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date
FROM
    (
            SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, user_id, session_time_in_minutes, cpu_usage_percent, max_cpu_usage, memory_usage_percent, max_memory_usage, user_cpu_usage_percent, max_user_cpu_usage_percent, system_cpu_usage_percent, max_system_cpu_usage_percent
            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_users_usage_hourly
        UNION
            SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, user_id, session_time_in_minutes, cpu_usage_percent, max_cpu_usage, memory_usage_percent, max_memory_usage, user_cpu_usage_percent, max_user_cpu_usage_percent, system_cpu_usage_percent, max_system_cpu_usage_percent 
            FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_users_usage_daily
            WHERE
                history_datetime <
                    (
                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                        FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_users_usage_hourly
                    )
    ) AS hourly_daily
    LEFT OUTER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
        ON 
            (
                hourly_daily.vm_id =
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id
            )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
        ON 
            (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id =
                v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                -- Here we get the latest cluster configurations
                AND v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                    IN 
                        (
                            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters a
                            GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                        )
            )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN v4_3_users_details_history
        ON 
            (
                hourly_daily.user_id =
                v4_3_users_details_history.user_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
    v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
        IN 
            (
                SELECT cluster_id
                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                WHERE datacenter_id = '$datacenter_id'
            )
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id IN ($cluster_id)
    -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
    AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
        IN 
            (
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms a
                GROUP BY a.vm_id
            )
    AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
    -- This will determine if deleted entities will be included in the report,
    -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
    AND 
        CASE
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                THEN 1=1
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                THEN v4_3_configuration_history_vms.delete_date isnull
        END
ORDER BY
    v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
    history_datetime,
    username,
    session_time_in_minutes DESC

panels.title: User Spice Session Activity (BR45)

panels.description: This report displays the number of running virtual machines and OS usage for a selected cluster within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR18 - This query returns for each OS the number
-- of active vms, up to an hour back.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    NOW () AS time,
    COALESCE ( os_type, 'RHEL' ) AS os_type,
    vm_count
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) = 'OTHER OS'
                    THEN 'Other OS'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%WINDOWS%'
                    THEN 'Windows'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'RHEL%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'RED HAT%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'OTHER L%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'LINUX'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%UBUNTU%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%SUSE%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                ELSE 'Other OS'
            END AS os_type,
            samples.history_datetime AS time,
            COUNT ( DISTINCT v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id ) AS vm_count
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, vm_status, vm_configuration_version 
                FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS samples
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id =
                        samples.vm_configuration_version
                    )
            INNER JOIN enum_translator enum_os_type
                ON 
                    (
                        enum_os_type.enum_key =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.operating_system
                        AND enum_os_type.enum_type = 'OS_TYPE'
                        AND language_code = 'en_US'
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms latest_config
                ON 
                    (
                        latest_config.vm_id =
                        samples.vm_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter only the vms that are in active status
            samples.vm_status = 1
            -- Filter vms list according to the cluster that was chosen by the user
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                        WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id IN ( $cluster_id ) 
                    )
            -- Here we get the vm latest configuration
            AND latest_config.history_id 
                IN
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms b
                        GROUP BY b.vm_id
                    )
            AND samples.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND samples.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- This will determine where deleted entities will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted' = 'No'
                        THEN latest_config.delete_date IS NULL
                    ELSE
                        latest_config.delete_date IS NULL
                        OR
                        latest_config.delete_date IS NOT NULL
                END
        GROUP BY
            -- Here we calculate for each OS type
            CASE
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) = 'OTHER OS'
                    THEN 'Other OS'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%WINDOWS%'
                    THEN 'Windows'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'RHEL%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'RED HAT%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'OTHER L%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'LINUX'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%UBUNTU%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%SUSE%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                ELSE 'Other OS'
            END,
            samples.History_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY os_type, time

-- BR18 - This query returns for each OS the number
-- of active vms, up to an hour back.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    NOW () AS time,
    COALESCE ( os_type, 'RHEL' ) AS os_type,
    vm_count
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) = 'OTHER OS'
                    THEN 'Other OS'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%WINDOWS%'
                    THEN 'Windows'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'RHEL%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'RED HAT%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'OTHER L%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'LINUX'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%UBUNTU%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%SUSE%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                ELSE 'Other OS'
            END AS os_type,
            hourly_daily.history_datetime AS time,
            COUNT ( DISTINCT v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id ) AS vm_count
        FROM 
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, vm_status, vm_configuration_version 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, vm_status, vm_configuration_version 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id =
                        hourly_daily.vm_configuration_version
                    )
            INNER JOIN enum_translator enum_os_type
                ON 
                    (
                        enum_os_type.enum_key =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.operating_system
                        AND enum_os_type.enum_type = 'OS_TYPE'
                        AND language_code = 'en_US'
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms latest_config
                ON 
                    (
                        latest_config.vm_id =
                        hourly_daily.vm_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter only the vms that are in active status
            hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
            -- Filter vms list according to the cluster that was chosen by the user
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                        WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id IN ( $cluster_id ) 
                    )
            -- Here we get the vm latest configuration
            AND latest_config.history_id 
                IN
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms b
                        GROUP BY b.vm_id
                    )
            AND hourly_daily.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND hourly_daily.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- This will determine where deleted entities will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted' = 'No'
                        THEN latest_config.delete_date IS NULL
                    ELSE
                        latest_config.delete_date IS NULL
                        OR
                        latest_config.delete_date IS NOT NULL
                END
        GROUP BY
            -- Here we calculate for each OS type
            CASE
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) = 'OTHER OS'
                    THEN 'Other OS'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%WINDOWS%'
                    THEN 'Windows'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'RHEL%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'RED HAT%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'OTHER L%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'LINUX'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%UBUNTU%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%SUSE%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                ELSE 'Other OS'
            END,
            hourly_daily.History_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY os_type, time

panels.title: Active Virtual Machines by OS (BR18)

panels.description: This report displays the number of running virtual machines and OS usage for a selected cluster over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR18 - This query returns for each OS the number
-- of active vms over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(time),
    COALESCE ( os_type, 'RHEL' ) AS os_type,
    vm_count
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) = 'OTHER OS'
                    THEN 'Other OS'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%WINDOWS%'
                    THEN 'Windows'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'RHEL%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'RED HAT%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'OTHER L%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'LINUX'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%UBUNTU%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%SUSE%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                ELSE 'Other OS'
            END AS os_type,
            samples.history_datetime AS time,
            COUNT ( DISTINCT v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id ) AS vm_count
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, vm_status, vm_configuration_version 
                FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS samples
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id =
                        samples.vm_configuration_version
                    )
            INNER JOIN enum_translator enum_os_type
                ON 
                    (
                        enum_os_type.enum_key =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.operating_system
                        AND enum_os_type.enum_type = 'OS_TYPE'
                        AND language_code = 'en_US'
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms latest_config
                ON 
                    (
                        latest_config.vm_id =
                        samples.vm_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter only the vms that are in active status
            samples.vm_status = 1
            -- Filter vms list according to the cluster that was chosen by the user
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                        WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id IN ( $cluster_id ) 
                    )
        
            -- Here we get the vm latest configuration
            AND latest_config.history_id 
                IN
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms b
                        GROUP BY b.vm_id
                    )
            AND samples.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND samples.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- This will determine where deleted entities will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted' = 'No'
                        THEN latest_config.delete_date IS NULL
                    ELSE
                        latest_config.delete_date IS NULL
                        OR
                        latest_config.delete_date IS NOT NULL
                END
        GROUP BY
            -- Here we calculate for each OS type
            CASE
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) = 'OTHER OS'
                    THEN 'Other OS'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%WINDOWS%'
                    THEN 'Windows'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'RHEL%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'RED HAT%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'OTHER L%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'LINUX'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%UBUNTU%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%SUSE%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                ELSE 'Other OS'
            END,
            samples.History_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY os_type, time

-- BR18 - This query returns for each OS the number
-- of active vms over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(time),
    COALESCE ( os_type, 'RHEL' ) AS os_type,
    vm_count
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            CASE
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) = 'OTHER OS'
                    THEN 'Other OS'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%WINDOWS%'
                    THEN 'Windows'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'RHEL%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'RED HAT%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'OTHER L%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE 'LINUX'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%UBUNTU%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) LIKE '%SUSE%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                ELSE 'Other OS'
            END AS os_type,
            hourly_daily.history_datetime AS time,
            COUNT ( DISTINCT v4_3_configuration_history_vms.vm_id ) AS vm_count
        FROM 
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, vm_status, vm_configuration_version 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, vm_status, vm_configuration_version
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id =
                        hourly_daily.vm_configuration_version
                    )
            INNER JOIN enum_translator enum_os_type
                ON 
                    (
                        enum_os_type.enum_key =
                        v4_3_configuration_history_vms.operating_system
                        AND enum_os_type.enum_type = 'OS_TYPE'
                        AND language_code = 'en_US'
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms latest_config
                ON 
                    (
                        latest_config.vm_id =
                        hourly_daily.vm_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter only the vms that are in active status
            hourly_daily.vm_status = 1
            -- Filter vms list according to the cluster that was chosen by the user
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                        WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id IN ( $cluster_id ) 
                    )
        
            -- Here we get the vm latest configuration
            AND latest_config.history_id 
                IN
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms b
                        GROUP BY b.vm_id
                    )
            AND hourly_daily.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND hourly_daily.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- This will determine where deleted entities will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted' = 'No'
                        THEN latest_config.delete_date IS NULL
                    ELSE
                        latest_config.delete_date IS NULL
                        OR
                        latest_config.delete_date IS NOT NULL
                END
        GROUP BY
            -- Here we calculate for each OS type
            CASE
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) = 'OTHER OS'
                    THEN 'Other OS'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%WINDOWS%'
                    THEN 'Windows'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'RHEL%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'RED HAT%'
                    THEN 'RHEL'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'OTHER L%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like 'LINUX'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%UBUNTU%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                WHEN UPPER ( COALESCE ( enum_os_type.value,'Other OS' ) ) like '%SUSE%'
                    THEN 'Other Linux'
                ELSE 'Other OS'
            END,
            hourly_daily.History_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY os_type, time

panels.title: Active Virtual Machines by OS (over time) (BR18)

panels.description: This report displays the number of hosts for each OS version for a selected cluster within a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR22 - This query returns for each OS version the 
-- number of hosts,  up to an hour back.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    NOW () AS time,
    COALESCE ( os_type, MAX ( os_type ) over (partition by 1), '' ) AS os_type,
    host_count
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            COALESCE ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_os, 'Unknown' ) AS os_type,
            samples.history_datetime AS time,
            COUNT ( DISTINCT samples.host_id ) AS host_count
        FROM  
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, host_id
                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS samples
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        samples.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                        WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id IN ( $cluster_id )
                    )

            AND samples.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND samples.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the host latest configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 
                        GROUP BY v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine where deleted entities will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter     
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted' = 'No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NULL
                    ELSE
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NULL
                        OR
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NOT NULL
                END
        GROUP BY
            -- Here we calculate for each OS version
            COALESCE ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_os, 'Unknown' ), 
            time
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY time

-- BR22 - This query returns for each OS version the 
-- number of hosts,  up to an hour back.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    NOW () AS time,
    COALESCE ( os_type, MAX ( os_type ) over (partition by 1), '' ) AS os_type,
    host_count
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            COALESCE ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_os, 'Unknown' ) AS os_type,
            hourly_daily.history_datetime AS time,
            COUNT ( DISTINCT hourly_daily.host_id ) AS host_count
        FROM  
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        hourly_daily.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                        WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id IN ( $cluster_id )
                    )

            AND hourly_daily.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND hourly_daily.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the host latest configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 
                        GROUP BY v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine where deleted entities will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter     
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted' = 'No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NULL
                    ELSE
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NULL
                        OR
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NOT NULL
                END
        GROUP BY
            -- Here we calculate for each OS version
            COALESCE ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_os, 'Unknown' ), 
            time
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY time

panels.title: Host OS Break Down (BR22)

panels.description: This report displays the number of hosts for each OS version for a selected cluster over a selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR22 - This query returns for each OS version the 
-- number of hosts over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(time),
    COALESCE ( os_type, MAX ( os_type ) over (partition by 1), '' ) AS os_type,
    host_count
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            COALESCE ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_os, 'Unknown' ) AS os_type,
            samples.history_datetime AS time,
            COUNT ( DISTINCT samples.host_id ) AS host_count
        FROM  
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, host_id 
                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS samples
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        samples.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                        WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id IN ( $cluster_id ) 
                    )
            AND samples.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND samples.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the host latest configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 
                        GROUP BY v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine where deleted entities will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter 
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted' = 'No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NULL
                    ELSE
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NULL
                        OR
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NOT NULL
                END
        GROUP BY
            -- Here we calculate for each OS version
            COALESCE ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_os, 'Unknown' ), 
            time
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY time

-- BR22 - This query returns for each OS version the 
-- number of hosts over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(time),
    COALESCE ( os_type, MAX ( os_type ) over (partition by 1), '' ) AS os_type,
    host_count
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            COALESCE ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_os, 'Unknown' ) AS os_type,
            hourly_daily.history_datetime AS time,
            COUNT ( DISTINCT hourly_daily.host_id ) AS host_count
        FROM  
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id 
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id
                    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        hourly_daily.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters
                        WHERE v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id IN ( $cluster_id ) 
                    )
            AND hourly_daily.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND hourly_daily.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the host latest configuration
            AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id )
                        FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 
                        GROUP BY v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine where deleted entities will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter 
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted' = 'No'
                        THEN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NULL
                    ELSE
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NULL
                        OR
                        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NOT NULL
                END
        GROUP BY
            -- Here we calculate for each OS version
            COALESCE ( v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.host_os, 'Unknown' ), 
            time
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
ORDER BY time

panels.title: Host OS Breakdown (over time) (BR22)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN datacenter_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				) 	 			AND datacenter_id  	         			    IN 			     				    ( 					 						SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters 					 						WHERE  					     						    cluster_id 					         						        IN 					             						            ( 									 										SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms  								 									) 						    OR cluster_id  						        IN 						            ( 										SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 										FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 									) 					) 	 			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                END
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT   CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  CASE          WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    THEN datacenter_name 	 	WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  END AS __text  		FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters  		WHERE       		    history_id           			    IN               				(  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				) 	 			AND datacenter_id  	         			    IN 			     				    ( 					 						SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters 					 						WHERE  					     						    cluster_id 					         						        IN 					             						            ( 									 										SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms  								 									) 						    OR cluster_id  						        IN 						            ( 										SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 										FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 									) 					) 	 			AND 	    			    CASE  	        				    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    THEN 1=1 		    					WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                END

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT        CAST ( cluster_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  	CASE      	    WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     		    THEN cluster_name 	 		WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      		    THEN cluster_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  	END AS __text  	FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters  	WHERE       	    history_id           		    IN               			    (  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters a  		         					GROUP BY a.cluster_id 	         				) 	 		AND  		    (  				cluster_id IN 			     			        ( 					 					    SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 					 					    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms 				 				    ) 		    OR cluster_id IN 			        ( 					    SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 					    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 				    )  			) 		AND 	    		    CASE  	        			    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            				    THEN 1=1 		    				WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        				    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date ISNULL 	    			END     		AND datacenter_id IN ('$datacenter_id')
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cluster_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT        CAST ( cluster_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  	CASE      	    WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     		    THEN cluster_name 	 		WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      		    THEN cluster_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  	END AS __text  	FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters  	WHERE       	    history_id           		    IN               			    (  	             					SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters a  		         					GROUP BY a.cluster_id 	         				) 	 		AND  		    (  				cluster_id IN 			     			        ( 					 					    SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 					 					    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_vms 				 				    ) 		    OR cluster_id IN 			        ( 					    SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 					    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts 				    )  			) 		AND 	    		    CASE  	        			    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            				    THEN 1=1 		    				WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        				    THEN v4_3_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date ISNULL 	    			END     		AND datacenter_id IN ('$datacenter_id')

title: Executive Dashboard
